back_cards.definition_en: to suppose something is true without proof
back_cards.example_en: I assume the meeting is at 10 a.m., but I’ll confirm.

back_cards.definition_en: to take on a role or responsibility
back_cards.example_en: She assumed the role of team leader after the promotion.

back_cards.definition_en: to accept something as a starting point
back_cards.example_en: Let’s assume the budget is fixed and plan accordingly.
The company assumed ownership of the small startup.

back_cards.definition_en: to pretend or adopt a manner
back_cards.example_en: He assumed a confident tone during the speech.

back_cards.definition_en: a person who creates written content
back_cards.example_en: The writer published a new novel last month.

back_cards.definition_en: someone who composes articles or reports
back_cards.example_en: She works as a freelance writer for a magazine.

back_cards.definition_en: an author of creative stories or scripts
back_cards.example_en: The writer crafted a thrilling movie screenplay.

back_cards.definition_en: a person who writes letters or emails
back_cards.example_en: He’s a thoughtful writer, sending letters to his family.

back_cards.definition_en: someone who documents ideas or research
back_cards.example_en: The scientist was also a skilled writer of academic papers.

back_cards.definition_en: to carry out an action or task
back_cards.example_en: The surgeon will perform the operation tomorrow.

back_cards.definition_en: to act or present in a play or show
back_cards.example_en: She loves to perform in the school theater production.

back_cards.definition_en: to execute a job or duty
back_cards.example_en: He performs his work with great precision.
This car performs well on mountain roads.

back_cards.definition_en: to demonstrate skill in a public setting
back_cards.example_en: The band will perform at the festival tonight.

back_cards.definition_en: recognition or praise for an achievement
back_cards.example_en: She deserves credit for organizing the event.
He used his credit to buy a new laptop.
She earned three credits for the course.

back_cards.definition_en: trust in someone’s ability to pay
back_cards.example_en: The store offered credit to loyal customers.
The director gave credit to the entire team.

back_cards.definition_en: having the color of grass or lime
back_cards.example_en: The green forest was vibrant in spring.
They switched to green energy to reduce emissions.
He’s still green and learning the job.
The green apples were too sour to eat.
Her green ideas inspired the team.

back_cards.definition_en: a legal union between two people
back_cards.example_en: Their marriage was celebrated with a big party.
The marriage of art and technology created a masterpiece.
The marriage took place in a beautiful garden.

back_cards.definition_en: a commitment to a shared life
back_cards.example_en: Their marriage has lasted over 20 years.
This dish is a marriage of sweet and savory flavors.
The patient recovered after a heart operation.
The rescue operation saved many lives.
The factory’s operation runs smoothly now.
The company expanded its operation overseas.
The operation was critical to national security.
It’s a cold day, indeed.

back_cards.definition_en: to confirm or agree with something
back_cards.example_en: You’re right; it’s a great plan, indeed.
He’s late again, indeed!
She’s talented and, indeed, very hardworking.
The project was tough; indeed, it took months.

back_cards.definition_en: to rest with eyes closed and body inactive
back_cards.example_en: I sleep for eight hours every night.

back_cards.definition_en: to be in a state of rest
back_cards.example_en: The baby sleeps peacefully in the crib.
We can’t sleep on this urgent issue.
They sleep at their grandparents’ house on weekends.
The volcano sleeps but could erupt someday.
Water is necessary for survival.
Training is necessary to improve skills.
Change was necessary after the crisis.
These tools are necessary for the project.
It’s necessary to wear a helmet while biking.
She will reveal the secret at the party.

back_cards.definition_en: to show or display something hidden
back_cards.example_en: The curtain rose to reveal a stunning set.
The report revealed new environmental data.
The investigation revealed corruption in the system.
His smile revealed his true feelings.

back_cards.definition_en: a person who acts on behalf of another
back_cards.example_en: The agent negotiated the contract for the actor.

back_cards.definition_en: a government or law enforcement official
back_cards.example_en: The FBI agent solved the case quickly.
Our real estate agent found us a great house.
The cleaning agent removed the stain.
She’s an agent of change in her community.

back_cards.definition_en: the ability to enter or use something
back_cards.example_en: Only members have access to the gym.

back_cards.definition_en: a way to approach or reach
back_cards.example_en: The path provides access to the beach.
She was granted access to the database.
His job gave him access to influential people.
Quick access to data is crucial for research.
We met at a cozy bar downtown.

back_cards.definition_en: a long, narrow piece of material
back_cards.example_en: The window was secured with an iron bar.

back_cards.definition_en: a counter for food or drink
back_cards.example_en: She grabbed a snack from the salad bar.

We had a debate about the best movie.

back_cards.definition_en: a part of a journey or race

back_cards.definition_en: a quantity held by a glass

back_cards.definition_en: to upgrade a system or process

back_cards.definition_en: a type of animal or plant
back_cards.example_en: This cow is from strong stock.

back_cards.definition_en: a base for soup or stew
back_cards.example_en: She made stock from chicken bones.
The car needs gas to run.

The kitchen uses natural gas.
That party was a total gas!

The ball landed in the middle of the field.

back_cards.definition_en: the central part of a period
back_cards.example_en: The project is in the middle of development.

back_cards.definition_en: the act of organizing people or resources
